comment: Ironically the least professional professor I've encountered. Rude and dismissive. I wish I could attach screenshots of her emails. I genuinely believe she did not read her own assignments. She had denied one of my assignments stating I hadn't followed directions and after me sending 3 emails asking how, "there was an internal error. sorry."

This is a very easy class and directions are straightforward. You submit your work and you are given feedback whether you have received the credit or not. The people who do not like this professor are people who cannot follow simple instructions or read. Do not hesitate on taking this professor you learn a lot regarding professionalism.

The absolute worst professor I've ever taken. Dr. Foster was consistently rude and unhelpful when I reached out with questions about assignments and did nothing to answer them. The class itself is easy, but dealing with her was highly frustrating and made the work extremely unenjoyable. DO NOT take her.

I requested an alternate assignment for an in-person event before the due date- she denied my request because I asked her the day of the meeting rather than 24 hours before. This was not stated on syllabus. I requested the alternate assignment because I have cancer- my doctors told me to avoid large groups- provided doctors note. She did not care.

Worst professor I ever had. Extremely rude when you reach out for help and does not try to help at all. Cleary does not care about success of students. Did not know what she was doing for the first entire month of class, no one has access to the course. Very unprofessional, I strongly advise against taking her. Horrible experience.

Maybe it's the class, maybe it's actually her. Both things I could've gone without, wish I saved my money and took this course with someone else. She takes it very seriously, rightfully so I suppose, but most of this is just reiterating things you learn in a junior high business class.
Professor Carolyn-Foster is AMAZING! So easy to talk to about career goals. Take her!
Carolyn is GREAT! She is very good at taking students' lofty ambitions and grounding them so that there is a real plan. If you have any confusion about your life she is very influential and helpful.

The class is mostly independent, where you complete around 10 assignments from a big list. You will have to attend a career fair in person and dress up, but the other assignments are pretty easy. You only chat with the professor once during your career counseling for about 15 to 30 minutes. The class is a pass or fail.
